intro: Cerastium maximum lusus latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a hardy and ornamental plant suitable for garden use in shady conditions.
